page.title: 13Housing in 1985
page.content: A lot of people have moved out of London to Cheshunt and the housing estates are fairly new.There are lots of different kinds of houses;bungalows, terraced houses,detached houses and semi-detached ,maisonettes and flats. Out of a survey of 26 people most people lived in semi-detached houses. On average there are 7 rooms in a house, there are bedrooms,a lounge,a kitchen and a bathroom and toilet. People decorate their houses with different colour wallpaper with matching carpets and curtains.Most houses have 2 gardens back and front,a drive-way and garage.The gardens are laid out with lawns,ponds,flowers and vegetable beds.In this area there are private and council housing estates. The council build houses which are then rented out fairly cheaply to people who cannot afford to buy their own houses.
